text: Resolution 1325 (2000)
Adopted by the Security Council at its 4213th meeting, on 31 October 2000
The Security Council,

Recalling its resolutions 1261 (1999) of 25 August 1999, 1265 (1999) of 17 September 1999, 1296 (2000) of 19 April 2000 and 1314 (2000) of 11 August 2000, as well as relevant statements of its President, and recalling also the statement of its President to the press on the occasion of the United Nations Day for Women’s Rights and International Peace (International Women’s Day) of 8 March 2000 (SC/6816),
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 1261 (1999) of 25 August 1999, 1265 (1999) of 17 September 1999, 1296 (2000) of 19 April 2000 and 1314 (2000) of 11 August 2000, as well as relevant statements of its President, and *recalling* also the statement of its President to the press on the occasion of the United Nations Day for Women’s Rights and International Peace (International Women’s Day) of 8 March 2000 (SC/6816),
uncertainties: Considered tagging 'its President' as 'President of the Security Council' (mentioned entity), but it is not in the provided entity list; thus omitted.

text: Recalling also the commitments of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (A/52/231) as well as those contained in the outcome document of the twenty-third Special Session of the United Nations General Assembly entitled “Women 2000: Gender Equality, Development and Peace for the Twenty-First Century” (A/S-23/10/Rev.1), in particular those concerning women and armed conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* also the commitments of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (A/52/231) as well as those contained in the outcome document of the twenty-third Special Session of the {{United Nations General Assembly}} entitled “Women 2000: Gender Equality, Development and Peace for the Twenty-First Century” (A/S-23/10/Rev.1), in particular those concerning women and armed conflict,

text: Bearing in mind the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and the primary responsibility of the Security Council under the Charter for the maintenance of international peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Bearing in mind* the purposes and principles of the Charter of the {{United Nations}} and the primary responsibility of the {{Security Council}} under the Charter for the maintenance of international peace and security,

text: Expressing concern that civilians, particularly women and children, account for the vast majority of those adversely affected by armed conflict, including as refugees and internally displaced persons, and increasingly are targeted by combatants and armed elements, and recognizing the consequent impact this has on durable peace and reconciliation,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing concern* that civilians, particularly women and children, account for the vast majority of those adversely affected by armed conflict, including as refugees and internally displaced persons, and increasingly are targeted by combatants and armed elements, and *recognizing* the consequent impact this has on durable peace and reconciliation,

text: Reaffirming the important role of women in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and in peace-building, and stressing the importance of their equal participation and full involvement in all efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security, and the need to increase their role in decision-making with regard to conflict prevention and resolution,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the important role of women in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and in peace-building, and *stressing* the importance of their equal participation and full involvement in all efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security, and the need to increase their role in decision-making with regard to conflict prevention and resolution,

text: Reaffirming also the need to implement fully international humanitarian and human rights law that protects the rights of women and girls during and after conflicts,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming also* the need to implement fully international humanitarian and human rights law that protects the rights of women and girls during and after conflicts,

text: Emphasizing the need for all parties to ensure that mine clearance and mine awareness programmes take into account the special needs of women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizing* the need for all parties to ensure that mine clearance and mine awareness programmes take into account the special needs of women and girls,

text: Recognizing the urgent need to mainstream a gender perspective into peacekeeping operations, and in this regard noting the Windhoek Declaration and the Namibia Plan of Action on Mainstreaming a Gender Perspective in Multidimensional Peace Support Operations (S/2000/693),
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the urgent need to mainstream a gender perspective into peacekeeping operations, and in this regard *noting* the Windhoek Declaration and the Namibia Plan of Action on Mainstreaming a Gender Perspective in Multidimensional Peace Support Operations (S/2000/693),
uncertainties: Windhoek Declaration and Namibia Plan of Action are documents, not entities from the provided list, so they are not marked as mentioned entities.

text: Recognizing also the importance of the recommendation contained in the statement of its President to the press of 8 March 2000 for specialized training for all peacekeeping personnel on the protection, special needs and human rights of women and children in conflict situations,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing also* the importance of the recommendation contained in the statement of {{its President}} to the press of 8 March 2000 for specialized training for all peacekeeping personnel on the protection, special needs and human rights of women and children in conflict situations,

text: Recognizing that an understanding of the impact of armed conflict on women and girls, effective institutional arrangements to guarantee their protection and full participation in the peace process can significantly contribute to the maintenance and promotion of international peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that an understanding of the impact of armed conflict on women and girls, effective institutional arrangements to guarantee their protection and full participation in the peace process can significantly contribute to the maintenance and promotion of international peace and security,

text: Noting the need to consolidate data on the impact of armed conflict on women and girls,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* the need to consolidate data on the impact of armed conflict on women and girls,

text: Urges Member States to ensure increased representation of women at all decision-making levels in national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention, management, and resolution of conflict;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to ensure increased representation of women at all decision-making levels in national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention, management, and resolution of conflict;
uncertainties: Considered whether to mark "increased representation of women" as a deliverable (policy-type), but treated it as too general and thus omitted.

text: Encourages the Secretary-General to implement his strategic plan of action (A/49/587) calling for an increase in the participation of women at decision-making levels in conflict resolution and peace processes;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strategic plan of action (A/49/587) to increase women's participation in peace processes

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* the <<Secretary-General>> to implement his [[strategic plan of action]] (A/49/587) calling for an increase in the participation of women at decision-making levels in conflict resolution and peace processes;

text: Urges the Secretary-General to appoint more women as special representatives and envoys to pursue good offices on his behalf, and in this regard calls on Member States to provide candidates to the Secretary-General, for inclusion in a regularly updated centralized roster;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* the <<Secretary-General>> to appoint more women as special representatives and envoys to pursue good offices on his behalf, and in this regard *calls on* <<Member States>> to provide [[candidates]] to the {{Secretary-General}}, for inclusion in a regularly updated centralized roster;
uncertainties: No deliverable type fits well for the appointment action; therefore no deliverable was annotated for the first clause.

text: Further urges the Secretary-General to seek to expand the role and contribution of women in United Nations field-based operations, and especially among military observers, civilian police, human rights and humanitarian personnel;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Expand women's role in UN field operations
deliverables.deliverable: expand the role and contribution of women

textWithHighlights: Further *urges* the <<Secretary-General>> to seek to [[expand the role and contribution of women]] in {{United Nations}} field-based operations, and especially among military observers, civilian police, human rights and humanitarian personnel;
uncertainties: The task to "seek to expand the role and contribution of women" is somewhat aspirational; categorized under policy as it implies institutional/staffing policy changes rather than a concrete, time-bound action.

text: Expresses its willingness to incorporate a gender perspective into peacekeeping operations, and urges the Secretary-General to ensure that, where appropriate, field operations include a gender component;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses* its willingness to incorporate a gender perspective into peacekeeping operations, and *urges* the <<Secretary-General>> to ensure that, where appropriate, field operations include a [[gender component]];
uncertainties: Considered but did not extract a deliverable for the 'expresses its willingness to incorporate a gender perspective' clause, since it is aspirational rather than a concrete task.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to provide to Member States training guidelines and materials on the protection, rights and the particular needs of women, as well as on the importance of involving women in all peacekeeping and peace-building measures, invites Member States to incorporate these elements as well as HIV/AIDS awareness training into their national training programmes for military and civilian police personnel in preparation for deployment, and further requests the Secretary-General to ensure that civilian personnel of peacekeeping operations receive similar training;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Training guidelines on protection and participation of women in peacekeeping and peace-building
Training materials on protection and participation of women in peacekeeping and peace-building
HIV/AIDS awareness training in national training programmes
Training for civilian personnel of peacekeeping operations on protection and participation of women

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to provide to Member States [[training guidelines]] and [[materials]] on the protection, rights and the particular needs of women, as well as on the importance of involving women in all peacekeeping and peace-building measures, *invites* <<Member States>> to incorporate these elements as well as [[HIV/AIDS awareness training]] into their national training programmes for military and civilian police personnel in preparation for deployment, and *further requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to ensure that civilian personnel of peacekeeping operations receive [[similar training]];
uncertainties: Mapped 'training guidelines' to 'standards' and 'materials' to 'information_sharing'; other categorizations (e.g., capacity_building) could arguably apply.

text: Urges Member States to increase their voluntary financial, technical and logistical support for gender-sensitive training efforts, including those undertaken by relevant funds and programmes, inter alia, the United Nations Fund for Women and United Nations Children’s Fund, and by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and other relevant bodies;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to increase their voluntary [[financial, technical and logistical support]] for gender-sensitive training efforts, including those undertaken by relevant funds and programmes, inter alia, the {{United Nations Fund for Women}} and {{United Nations Children’s Fund}}, and by the {{Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees}} and other relevant bodies;
uncertainties: The deliverable spans both financial and non-financial forms of support; classified under technical_assistance to capture the supportive nature, though financial_resources could also apply.

text: Calls on all actors involved, when negotiating and implementing peace agreements, to adopt a gender perspective, including, inter alia:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Adoption of a gender perspective in peace agreements

textWithHighlights: *Calls on* all actors involved, when negotiating and implementing peace agreements, to [[adopt a gender perspective]], including, inter alia:
uncertainties: "all actors involved" is too vague to map to a concrete assignee category, so no assignee is recorded.

text: The special needs of women and girls during repatriation and resettlement and for rehabilitation, reintegration and post-conflict reconstruction;
textWithHighlights: The special needs of women and girls during repatriation and resettlement and for rehabilitation, reintegration and post-conflict reconstruction;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive verb (“calls on”) from the parent clause addressing “all actors involved” in peace agreements. The assignee is not captured because “all actors involved” is not a concrete entity per the schema. No concrete deliverables are specified in this item; it lists an aspect of a gender perspective rather than an actionable task.

text: Measures that support local women’s peace initiatives and indigenous processes for conflict resolution, and that involve women in all of the implementation mechanisms of the peace agreements;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Support for local women's peace initiatives and indigenous conflict-resolution processes
Inclusion of women in implementation mechanisms of peace agreements

textWithHighlights: Measures that [[support local women’s peace initiatives]] and indigenous processes for conflict resolution, and that [[involve women]] in all of the implementation mechanisms of the peace agreements;
uncertainties: Assignee is inherited from the parent clause (“Calls on all actors involved…”). Deliverable type categorized as “policy” since the text calls for measures/inclusion rather than a specific funding or training activity.

text: Measures that ensure the protection of and respect for human rights of women and girls, particularly as they relate to the constitution, the electoral system, the police and the judiciary;
textWithHighlights: Measures that ensure the protection of and respect for human rights of women and girls, particularly as they relate to the constitution, the electoral system, the police and the judiciary;
uncertainties: Operative verb inherited from parent ('Calls on'). The assignee 'all actors involved' from the parent clause is not a concrete entity in the list, so no assignee recorded. The item describes general measures and is insufficiently concrete to mark as a deliverable.

text: Calls upon all parties to armed conflict to respect fully international law applicable to the rights and protection of women and girls, especially as civilians, in particular the obligations applicable to them under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 and the Additional Protocols thereto of 1977, the Refugee Convention of 1951 and the Protocol thereto of 1967, the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women of 1979 and the Optional Protocol thereto of 1999 and the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child of 1989 and the two Optional Protocols thereto of 25 May 2000, and to bear in mind the relevant provisions of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<all parties to armed conflict>> to respect fully international law applicable to the rights and protection of women and girls, especially as civilians, in particular the obligations applicable to them under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 and the Additional Protocols thereto of 1977, the Refugee Convention of 1951 and the Protocol thereto of 1967, the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women of 1979 and the Optional Protocol thereto of 1999 and the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child of 1989 and the two Optional Protocols thereto of 25 May 2000, and to bear in mind the relevant provisions of the Rome Statute of the {{International Criminal Court}};

text: Calls on all parties to armed conflict to take special measures to protect women and girls from gender-based violence, particularly rape and other forms of sexual abuse, and all other forms of violence in situations of armed conflict;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Special measures to protect women and girls from gender-based violence
deliverables.deliverable: special measures to protect women and girls from gender-based violence

textWithHighlights: *Calls on* <<all parties to armed conflict>> to take [[special measures to protect women and girls from gender-based violence]], particularly rape and other forms of sexual abuse, and all other forms of violence in situations of armed conflict;
uncertainties: Classified the deliverable as 'policy' since 'measures' implies policy/action steps; assignee 'all parties to armed conflict' mapped to 'other' as it may include non-state actors.

text: Emphasizes the responsibility of all States to put an end to impunity and to prosecute those responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes including those relating to sexual and other violence against women and girls, and in this regard stresses the need to exclude these crimes, where feasible from amnesty provisions;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Exclusion of international crimes from amnesty provisions
deliverables.deliverable: exclude these crimes, where feasible from amnesty provisions

textWithHighlights: *Emphasizes* the responsibility of <<all States>> to put an end to impunity and to prosecute those responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes including those relating to sexual and other violence against women and girls, and in this regard *stresses* the need to [[exclude these crimes, where feasible from amnesty provisions]];
uncertainties: Considered whether to also model 'put an end to impunity' and 'prosecute those responsible' as deliverables, but omitted due to lack of a fitting deliverable category and to remain conservative. The assignee for the 'stresses' clause is implicit (likely Member States) but not explicit, so left empty.

text: Calls upon all parties to armed conflict to respect the civilian and humanitarian character of refugee camps and settlements, and to take into account the particular needs of women and girls, including in their design, and recalls its resolutions 1208 (1998) of 19 November 1998 and 1296 (2000) of 19 April 2000;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<all parties to armed conflict>> to respect the civilian and humanitarian character of refugee camps and settlements, and to take into account the particular needs of women and girls, including in their design, and *recalls* its resolutions 1208 (1998) of 19 November 1998 and 1296 (2000) of 19 April 2000;
uncertainties: Considered but did not mark deliverables for 'respect the civilian and humanitarian character' and 'take into account the particular needs of women and girls' as these are behavioral obligations rather than concrete deliverables per the schema.

text: Encourages all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration to consider the different needs of female and male ex-combatants and to take into account the needs of their dependants;

assignees.assignee: all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration>> to consider the different needs of female and male ex-combatants and to take into account the needs of their dependants;
uncertainties: Assignee is generalized and normalized as 'DDR planners' (not a standard list entity). The instructions to 'consider' and 'take into account' needs are treated as too vague to extract as concrete deliverables.

text: Reaffirms its readiness, whenever measures are adopted under Article 41 of the Charter of the United Nations, to give consideration to their potential impact on the civilian population, bearing in mind the special needs of women and girls, in order to consider appropriate humanitarian exemptions;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* its readiness, whenever measures are adopted under Article 41 of the Charter of the United Nations, to give consideration to their potential impact on the civilian population, bearing in mind the special needs of women and girls, in order to consider appropriate humanitarian exemptions;
uncertainties: No concrete deliverables or assignees are present; the paragraph expresses a stance (readiness to consider humanitarian exemptions) rather than assigning tasks or specifying an action to produce an output.

text: Expresses its willingness to ensure that Security Council missions take into account gender considerations and the rights of women, including through consultation with local and international women’s groups;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses its willingness* to ensure that {{Security Council}} missions take into account gender considerations and the rights of women, including through consultation with local and international {{women’s groups}};
uncertainties: Considered whether 'consultation with local and international women’s groups' should be captured as a deliverable (meeting), but treated it as part of an evaluative statement without a concrete task or assignee.

text: Invites the Secretary-General to carry out a study on the impact of armed conflict on women and girls, the role of women in peace-building and the gender dimensions of peace processes and conflict resolution, and further invites him to submit a report to the Security Council on the results of this study and to make this available to all Member States of the United Nations;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Study on impact of armed conflict on women and girls; role of women in peace-building; gender dimensions of peace processes and conflict resolution
Report on results of the study
Make the report available to all Member States

textWithHighlights: *Invites* the <<Secretary-General>> to carry out a [[study]] on the impact of armed conflict on women and girls, the role of women in peace-building and the gender dimensions of peace processes and conflict resolution, and *further invites* him to submit a [[report]] to the {{Security Council}} on the results of this study and to [[make this available]] to all {{Member States}} of the United Nations;
uncertainties: "this" in "make this available" appears to refer to the report on the study’s results.

text: Requests the Secretary-General, where appropriate, to include in his reporting to the Security Council progress on gender mainstreaming throughout peacekeeping missions and all other aspects relating to women and girls;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: update on gender mainstreaming in peacekeeping

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>>, where appropriate, to include in his reporting to the {{Security Council}} [[progress on gender mainstreaming]] throughout peacekeeping missions and all other aspects relating to women and girls;
uncertainties: The requested inclusion could be categorized as an 'update' (progress reporting) or as part of a 'report'. Chosen type: update.

text: Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
textWithHighlights: *Decides* to remain actively seized of the matter.
